text:
Na casa isolada em que estavam, a varanda dava direto no mar, uma parte límpida e vazia dele. [redacted_name] entrou naquela água, seu lugar de refúgio e onde tentava passar boa parte do dia, já que batia sol lá e[redacted_name] não gostava do sol.
Ele estava em uma poltrona inflável de piscina, pensando em maneiras de matar. Enquanto isso, a alguns metros dele, sentado na plataforma de madeira da varanda que a conectava ao mar, seu alvo vivia na feliz ignorância sobre as ideias da mente do marido.
[redacted_name]usava uma roupa de banho listrada, com mangas curtas e a parte de baixo chegando até os joelhos. Além disso, estava com óculos de sol e um chapéu de praia com aba bem larga, sem contar o guarda-sol preto que o cobria. Passava protetor solar pela terceira vez quando interrompeu as divagações do seu companheiro.
— Gatinho! Tem certeza de que não vai passar mais protetor?
trans:
In the secluded house where they were staying, the porch opened directly onto the sea, a clear and empty part of it. [redacted_name] entered that water, his place of refuge where he tried to spend most of the day since the sun shone there and [redacted_name] didn't like the sun.
He was in an inflatable pool chair, thinking of ways to kill. Meanwhile, a few meters away from him, sitting on the wooden platform of the porch that connected it to the sea, his target lived in blissful ignorance of the ideas in her husband's mind.
[redacted_name] was wearing a striped swimsuit, with short sleeves and the bottom part reaching down to her knees. In addition, she was wearing sunglasses and a wide-brimmed beach hat, not to mention the black parasol that covered her. She was applying sunscreen for the third time when she interrupted her partner's daydreams.
— Honey! Are you sure you don't want to put on more sunscreen?
